name: py-panel

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: A high level app and dashboarding solution for Python.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-param
dependencies.description:
Param is a library providing Parameters: Python attributes extended to
have features such as type and range checking, dynamically generated
values, documentation strings, default values, etc., each of which is
inherited from parent classes if not specified in a subclass.

dependencies.name: py-pyct
dependencies.description:
Python package common tasks for users (e.g. copy examples, fetch data,
...)

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-bokeh
dependencies.description: Statistical and novel interactive HTML plots for Python

dependencies.name: py-pyviz-comms
dependencies.description: Bidirectional communication for the HoloViz ecosystem.

dependencies.name: py-markdown
dependencies.description:
This is a Python implementation of John Gruber's Markdown. It is almost
completely compliant with the reference implementation, though there are
a few very minor differences. See John's Syntax Documentation for the
syntax rules.

dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions
dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).
